intro: Aneurolepidium kopetdaghense, commonly known as the Kopetdag meadowgrass, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia, particularly found in regions such as Kazakhstan and Turkmenistan. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit with slender, leafy stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets, typical of many grass species. It thrives in dry, temperate climates and is often found in meadows and open grasslands. Aneurolepidium kopetdaghense plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
